page.title: 03Transport In Bishop Monkton
page.content: Transport in the area relies almost solely on the internal combustion engine and road traffic,the most popular form being the private car,of which a number of households run 2 or more.Motor-cycles,especially the smaller versions are also quite widely used and the increasing cost of fuel has made the pedal cycle more popular than for some years.Public transport consists of a bus service to and from Harrogate and Ripon,the service being 7 in each direction daily,but outside school travelling hours these are only lightly used.The National coach network does not pass through the area but connection to it is possible through the bus service. There are now no train services through the area but parts of the old track alignment are still visible. The nearest public airport is Yeadon.
